title-group.article-title: The Volume Acoustic Modes of Spark-Ignited Internal Combustion Chambers

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1999 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Acoustic standing waves are excited in internal combustion chambers by both normal combustion and autoignition. The energy in these acoustic modes can be transmitted through the engine block and radiated as high-frequency engine noise. Using finite-element models of two different (four-valve and two-valve) production engine combustion chambers, the mode shapes and relative frequencies of the in-cylinder volume acoustic modes are calculated as a function of crank angle. The model is validated by comparison to spectrograms of experimental time-sampled waveforms (from flushmounted cylinder pressure sensors and accelerometers) from these two typical production spark-ignited engines.
